author: FlyRobinFly03
title: A set for only Knight Rider fans.
review: I am a big fan of Knight Rider and its one of my favorite tv shows ever, so of course I would buy this set. The really big thing about this set is Michael. I think Michael is such a great minifigure. That torso print is amazing and I love that hair and he looks very accurate to the tv show. Obliviously, the main build would K.I.T.T.(Knight industries two thousand) as he's Michael's partner in crime. I think the mini build is great for a lego dimensions pack, but I really wish that they added a license plate and a sticker saying KNIGHT or instead of a sticker a printed piece. The second vehicle is Goliath(Garth Knight's big rig) is a pretty cool addition. It looks very accurate to the show except its not black, but the alternate builds are supposed to be built with the same pieces so its okay. The weakest part of the set is the jet build. The jet does not appear in the show and it just looks weird seeing K.I.T.T. as a jet, but they needed a third build so its fine, but it still looks weird. So overall this set is a great set for fans of the show like me, however I don't think people that don't like the show would really like it except for the torso. So if you're a fan of the show you should buy this set. If your not and only want that torso you should probably wait for the Spider-man homecoming sets for the torso. Fingers crossed for Knight Rider theme.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Help protect the world with the CEO of Knight Industries
review:
Set #71286 Knight Rider Fun Pack: Welcome to another staple of the 1980’s, where those of us who grew up within that era were often seen watching David Hasslehoff as Michael Knight an intrepid adventurer with a talking car trying to solve some kind of crime… ok honestly, I haven’t seen the series in a long time, so forgive me if I messed up the premise slightly.

Packaging

Michael himself is front and center with K.I.T.T. taking up the space where you’d typically find the Adventure World shot in the background, instead go to the back of the package to see what the Adventure World looks like. Everything here is pretty much the same of wat you’d expect for LEGO Dimensions packaging.

Parts

This set offers a lot of black elements, the majority of the build uses black as the primary colour, so… really not much to say. Black tires, black rims, black cheese slopes and other similar small elements. Yeah, not much for MOC builders looking for parts packs with this particular set.

Minifigures

Michael Knight: With his trademark smirk and the unique hair piece this Minifigure has it definitely bears some resemblance to the 80’s version of Hasslehoff. The torso has a generic looking black jacket printed over a dark reddish shirt, it’s perfect for folks who want to make their own Minifigs, aside from the standard licensed Minifigure skin tone this character really doesn’t stand out much. He also does not include any hand-held accessories.

The build

K.I.T.T.: Is this another car build? Yep, it’s another micro built vehicle, specifically the classic looking KITT or Knight Industries Two Thousand, an experimental driverless vehicle with an Artificial Intelligence. The model is built very nicely and without any tricky or difficult moments.

Goliath Armored Semi: Taking a car and turning it into the cab of a large semi-truck isn’t entirely easy. This model is a bit out of scale, but the build is simple and straight forward and extremely enjoyable for what it is.

K.I.T.T. Jet: Now you make a flying car, hmmm, where have we seen that before? Oh right, Marty has one. Obviously this vehicle is more in keeping with the KITT look, and the build is solid though a bit lacking when compared to the digital model used in-game.

The completed model

K.I.T.T. & Alternate Models: This trio of models is very well executed, you can take them off the toy tag and play with them and enjoy swapping them between each model, the Car is the most iconic for fans of the franchise and is a very solid model, the truck is a bit small, but works well for what you get and the jet is just a really impressive third option. I am honestly impressed with what they managed to do for these models because it isn’t easy to make black vehicles look good, but they pulled it off.

The Digital Content

Adventure World: Knight Rider is a television series thoroughly set in the 80’s and what we have here is a pretty solid Adventure World to visit, if I’m not mistaken it is centered primarily around Reno or possibly Las Vegas itself, the central area is mostly hotels and casinos while the outliers have desert race tracks and highways, a mine and some other areas you’d expect to see. You also don’t get any glitches here, at least I never encountered any while playing this area of the game.

Battle Arena: Knight Rider Bright Light City is the name of the battle arena you can visit when you go head-to-head with three of your buddies to see who comes out on top. As I’ve noted before I really do not have much to say because I don’t visit them. Odeinoichus is a lonely AFOL alas.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Though not as numerous as Marceline Michael Knight does have a decent selection of abilities in keeping with his skills, he has Acrobat, Hacking, Technology, Tracking and X-Ray Vision. Really impressive.

KITT can use Accelerator Switches and Destroy Gold LEGO Objects, the Goliath Armored Semi can also use the Accelerator Switches while gaining the ability to Destroy Cracked LEGO Objects, interact with Electricity switches/puzzles and use Tow-Bar hooks. The KITT Jet is a flying vehicle, standard abilities include Flight Docks, Flight Cargo Hooks, Tow-Bar and he can destroy Gold and Silver LEGO Objects.

Overall opinion

If you want to experience everything in the game this pack is needed. If you want a LEGO version of a character made famous by David Hasslehoff in his younger days you’ll want this set. If you want to hear a snarky British sounding car interact with characters in LEGO Dimensions with unique dialogue clips, you can’t go wrong picking up this Fun Pack. Highly Recommended.
